hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After Stress Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: When market transitions from STRESS to NEUTRAL regime, BTC exhibits mean reversion toward its 20-day volume-weighted average price (VWAP) within 5 trading days, with >65% success rate when liquidity metrics (bid-ask spreads, order book depth) improve by >15% from stress lows.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Stress regimes create liquidity gaps where price overshoots fair value. As market makers return and order books rebuild, price reverts toward volume-weighted equilibrium. The transition period offers asymmetric risk/reward.
entry_conditions: Regime shifts from STRESS to NEUTRAL (confirmed by regime model)
Aggregate crypto exchange liquidity score improves >15% from 7-day low
BTC perpetual funding rates turn positive after >48h negative

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Regime reverts to STRESS OR liquidity score deteriorates >10% from entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Success rate <65% over 50+ instances OR mean reversion fails when liquidity improves (suggesting structural damage to market making infrastructure).
